title: Patriots reportedly targeting Dolphins pass rusher ahead of trade deadline
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots reportedly target Dolphins pass rusher Jaelan Phillips before NFL trade deadline, per The Athletic.
Phillips, 26, ranks 11th in pressures and 13th in pass-rush win rate among edge rushers this season.
Dolphins' potential trades follow their 2-7 start and recent loss to the Ravens, with GM also departing.

title: Marco Sturm: Bruins’ Mason Lohrei should be angry after getting scratched again
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mason Lohrei has been a healthy scratch for the Bruins' last three games against the Hurricanes.
Coach Marco Sturm encourages Lohrei to use his benching as a learning opportunity to improve defensively.
Lohrei's usual pairing with Charlie McAvoy struggled, while McAvoy and Nikita Zadorov have surrendered fewer goals recently.

title: 5 things to know about Falcons before Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Falcons enter Sunday's game against Patriots with a 3-4 record, hoping for a playoff push.
Falcons' Bijan Robinson leads NFL in scrimmage yards per game and is a dual-threat as runner and receiver.
Falcons' defense ranks second in the league in yards allowed, bolstered by strong secondary performance.

title: Pair of former Red Sox save Dodgers to force Game 7 of World Series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mookie Betts hit a crucial two-run single in the Dodgers' 3-1 Game 6 win over the Blue Jays.
Kiké Hernandez made a decisive defensive play to stop a Blue Jays rally and secure the Dodgers' victory.
The win forces a decisive Game 7 in the World Series between the Dodgers and the Blue Jays.

title: Frights and delights: A look at some of Boston’s stand-out Halloween costumes
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: MBTA staff dressed as Wizard of Oz characters and a 'T princess' distributed candy on the T during Halloween.
Boston Children's Hospital had a visit from Celtics star Jayson Tatum during Halloween amidst spirited costume celebrations.
Boston Medical Center's NICU featured costumes on babies, including superheroes and Celtics champions, handcrafted by nurses.

title: A winning Powerball ticket remains unclaimed in Mass. — and expires next month
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A $50,000 winning Powerball ticket purchased in Marlborough, Mass., last November remains unclaimed.
The ticket, bought at New Capital Farms, matched four numbers and the Powerball from the November 20, 2024, drawing.
Prize money will return to the state for distribution if unclaimed by November 20, benefiting Massachusetts' 351 cities and towns.

title: W. Va. couple had their dream Halloween wedding in Salem
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Thaddeus and Danielle Martin from West Virginia married on Halloween at Salem Willows Park.
The ceremony was captured by Jay Willet of WBZ for radio and television amidst gusty winds.
The couple spent a week on the North Shore, touring and waiting for their marriage license.

title: Jaylen Brown continues to shine as Celtics hold off furious 76ers run, win third straight: 9 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Jaylen Brown led the Boston Celtics with 32 points, shooting 13-for-19, in a narrow 109-108 victory over the 76ers.
The Celtics struggled to maintain a lead, facing a late game surge by the 76ers, but ultimately secured their third consecutive win.
Anfernee Simons displayed aggressive play, contributing significantly to the Celtics' lead, finishing with a team-high +23 in the box score.

title: Julia Fox defends controversial Jackie O. Halloween costume
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Julia Fox faced backlash for her Halloween costume, dressing as Jacqueline Kennedy in a bloodied pink suit.
Jack Schlossberg criticized Fox's costume on social media, labeling it "disgusting, desperate and dangerous."
Fox defended the outfit as a statement on Jackie Kennedy's deliberate choice to wear the blood-stained suit.

title: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr., WR Drake London set to play vs. Patriots
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr. and WR Drake London are set to play against the Patriots after recovering from injuries.
Penix and London were fully active in practice and missed last week's game where the Falcons lost 34-10 to the Dolphins.
The Patriots are on a 5-game winning streak, while the Falcons are on a 2-game losing streak heading into their matchup.
